answers.author: Joshua Wheatley
answers.text:
I am an MPA student and took a program evaluation course last year.  We read a collection of recent program evaluation classics, put out by JPAM, that I highly recommend.  Here is the reference:
Pirog, M. (Ed.). (2008). Journal of Policy Analysis and Management Classics Series: Social experimentation, program evaluation, and public policy. Hoboken, NJ: Wiley-Blackwell.

answers.author: Jonathan Walker
answers.text:
Municipal Benchmarks: Assessing Local Performance and Establishing Community Standards, Third Edition - 2012 by Ammons.  David Ammons is a professor at University of North Carolina.  He was previously with University of Georgia (not relevant, but a shout out) when I attended school there.  He has produced several publications that you could use, including the above textbook.

answers.author: Wydale Holmes
answers.text:
I suggest "Evaluation in Practice, A Methodological Approach" by Richard D. Bingham and Claire L. Felbinger.  I utilized the textbook in my MPA program and still reference it years later.  Also, Laura Peck teaches an outanding Program Evaluation course at ASU.

author: Leslie Beauregard
text:
I am teaching a course this fall on evaluating public programs.  Anyone know of or used a good, solid textbook on this topic?  Would appreciate some suggestions!
Thanks!
Leslie Beauregard
title: Evaluating Public Programs - Good Resources?
